chat.content:
I will give you a Coq proof state, including both hypotheses and a specific goal and your need to prove it. Your response should be a singular code block of Coq proof starting with "```coq
", ending with "Qed.```", without any additional explanation or commentary. Follow to these guidelines:
Introduce variables using unique names to avoid any conflicts.
Keep each command distinct and separated, avoid concatenations like ';' or '[cmd|cmd]'.
Organize your proof with bullets like '-', '+', and '*' instead of braces ({, }). Shift to their double symbols like '--' and '++', when necessary.
Effectively use given premises, follow the syntax and structure demonstrated in the examples provided.

Example 1:

Hypotheses:
n, m: nat
IHn: m + n = n + m

Goal:
m + S n = S n + m

Proof:
```coq
simpl. rewrite <- IHn. auto.
Qed.```

Example 2:
Hypotheses:

Goal:
forall n m : nat, m + n = n + m

```coq
intros n m. induction n.
- simpl. auto.
- simpl. rewrite <- IHn. auto.
Qed.```

Solve This Proof State:

Hypotheses:
y: nat
x: nat
ll: list nat

Goal:
x < y -> nat_sorted (y :: ll) -> nat_sorted (x :: y :: ll)

Premises:
Inductive list (A : Type) : Type := nil : list A | cons : A -> list A -> list A Arguments list _%type_scope Arguments nil {A}%type_scope Arguments cons {A}%type_scope a l%list_scope : rename
nat_sorted = fun ll : list nat => forall (l : list nat) (a : nat) (m : list nat) (b : nat) (r : list nat), ll = l ++ a :: m ++ b :: r -> a < b : list nat -> Prop Arguments nat_sorted _%list_scope
list_an_duplicate_inv : forall (a n : nat) (l : list nat) (x : nat) (m : list nat) (y : nat) (r : list nat), list_an a n = l ++ x :: m ++ y :: r -> a <= x /\ x < y < a + n
in_nat_sorted_1 : forall x : nat, nat_sorted (x :: nil)
Forall2_cons_inv : forall (X Y : Type) (R : X -> Y -> Prop) (x : X) (l : list X) (y : Y) (m : list Y), Forall2 R (x :: l) (y :: m) < -> R x y /\ Forall2 R l m
Permutation.Permutation_sind : forall (A : Type) (P : list A -> list A -> SProp), P nil nil -> (forall (x : A) (l l' : list A), l ~p l' -> P l l' -> P (x :: l) (x :: l')) -> (forall (x y : A) (l : list A), P (y :: x :: l) (x :: y :: l)) -> (forall l l' l'' : list A, l ~p l' -> P l l' -> l' ~p l'' -> P l' l'' -> P l l'') -> forall l l0 : list A, l ~p l0 -> P l l0
Permutation.Permutation_ind : forall (A : Type) (P : list A -> list A -> Prop), P nil nil -> (forall (x : A) (l l' : list A), l ~p l' -> P l l' -> P (x :: l) (x :: l')) -> (forall (x y : A) (l : list A), P (y :: x :: l) (x :: y :: l)) -> (forall l l' l'' : list A, l ~p l' -> P l l' -> l' ~p l'' -> P l' l'' -> P l l'') -> forall l l0 : list A, l ~p l0 -> P l l0
Permutation.Permutation_ind_bis : forall (A : Type) (P : list A -> list A -> Prop), P nil nil -> (forall (x : A) (l l' : list A), l ~p l' -> P l l' -> P (x :: l) (x :: l')) -> (forall (x y : A) (l l' : list A), l ~p l' -> P l l' -> P (y :: x :: l) (x :: y :: l')) -> (forall l l' l'' : list A, l ~p l' -> P l l' -> l' ~p l'' -> P l' l'' -> P l l'') -> forall l l' : list A, l ~p l' -> P l l'
Relation_Operators.Ltl_ind : forall (A : Set) (leA : A -> A -> Prop) (P : list A -> list A -> Prop), (forall (a : A) (x : list A), P nil (a :: x)) -> (forall a b : A, leA a b -> forall x y : list A, P (a :: x) (b :: y)) -> (forall (a : A) (x y : list A), Relation_Operators.Ltl A leA x y -> P x y -> P (a :: x) (a :: y)) -> forall l l0 : list A, Relation_Operators.Ltl A leA l l0 -> P l l0
Forall2_ind : forall (A B : Type) (R : A -> B -> Prop) (P : list A -> list B -> Prop), P nil nil -> (forall (x : A) (y : B) (l : list A) (l' : list B), R x y -> Forall2 R l l' -> P l l' -> P (x :: l) (y :: l')) -> forall (l : list A) (l0 : list B), Forall2 R l l0 -> P l l0
list_cons_app_cons_eq_inv : forall (X : Type) (l2 r1 r2 : list X) (x y : X), x :: r1 = l2 ++ y :: r2 -> (l2 = nil /\ x = y /\ r1 = r2) + {m : list X | l2 = x :: m /\ r1 = m ++ y :: r2}
Permutation.perm_swap : forall (A : Type) (x y : A) (l : list A), y :: x :: l ~p x :: y :: l
Permutation.Permutation_transp_sind : forall (A : Type) (P : list A -> list A -> SProp), (forall l : list A, P l l) -> (forall (x y : A) (l1 l2 : list A), P (l1 ++ y :: x :: l2) (l1 ++ x :: y :: l2)) -> (forall l l' l'' : list A, Permutation.Permutation_transp l l' -> P l l' -> Permutation.Permutation_transp l' l'' -> P l' l'' -> P l l'') -> forall l l0 : list A, Permutation.Permutation_transp l l0 -> P l l0
Permutation.Permutation_ind_transp : forall (A : Type) (P : list A -> list A -> Prop), (forall l : list A, P l l) -> (forall (x y : A) (l1 l2 : list A), P (l1 ++ y :: x :: l2) (l1 ++ x :: y :: l2)) -> (forall l l' l'' : list A, l ~p l' -> P l l' -> l' ~p l'' -> P l' l'' -> P l l'') -> forall l1 l2 : list A, l1 ~p l2 -> P l1 l2
Permutation.Permutation_transp_ind : forall (A : Type) (P : list A -> list A -> Prop), (forall l : list A, P l l) -> (forall (x y : A) (l1 l2 : list A), P (l1 ++ y :: x :: l2) (l1 ++ x :: y :: l2)) -> (forall l l' l'' : list A, Permutation.Permutation_transp l l' -> P l l' -> Permutation.Permutation_transp l' l'' -> P l' l'' -> P l l'') -> forall l l0 : list A, Permutation.Permutation_transp l l0 -> P l l0
map_cons_inv : forall (X Y : Type) (f : X -> Y) (ll : list X) (y : Y) (m : list Y), map f ll = y :: m -> {x : X & {l : list X | ll = x :: l /\ f x = y /\ map f l = m}}
Permutation.perm_t_swap : forall (A : Type) (x y : A) (l1 l2 : list A), Permutation.Permutation_transp (l1 ++ y :: x :: l2) (l1 ++ x :: y :: l2)
Inductive Permutation (A : Type) : list A -> list A -> Prop := perm_nil : nil ~p nil | perm_skip : forall (x : A) (l l' : list A), l ~p l' -> x :: l ~p x :: l' | perm_swap : forall (x y : A) (l : list A), y :: x :: l ~p x :: y :: l | perm_trans : forall l l' l'' : list A, l ~p l' -> l' ~p l'' -> l ~p l'' Arguments Permutation.Permutation [A]%type_scope (_ _)%list_scope Arguments Permutation.perm_nil _%type_scope Arguments Permutation.perm_skip [A]%type_scope _ [l l']%list_scope Arguments Permutation.perm_swap [A]%type_scope _ _ _%list_scope Arguments Permutation.perm_trans [A]%type_scope [l l' l'']%list_scope
Inductive Forall2 (A B : Type) (R : A -> B -> Prop) : list A -> list B -> Prop := Forall2_nil : Forall2 R nil nil | Forall2_cons : forall (x : A) (y : B) (l : list A) (l' : list B), R x y -> Forall2 R l l' -> Forall2 R (x :: l) (y :: l') Arguments Forall2 [A B]%type_scope _%function_scope (_ _)%list_scope Arguments Forall2_nil [A B]%type_scope _%function_scope Arguments Forall2_cons [A B]%type_scope [R]%function_scope _ _ [l l']%list_scope
f_equal_nat : forall (B : Type) (f : nat -> B) (x y : nat), x = y -> f x = f y
app_comm_cons : forall (A : Type) (x y : list A) (a : A), a :: x ++ y = (a :: x) ++ y
Inductive Permutation_transp (A : Type) : list A -> list A -> Prop := perm_t_refl : forall l : list A, Permutation.Permutation_transp l l | perm_t_swap : forall (x y : A) (l1 l2 : list A), Permutation.Permutation_transp (l1 ++ y :: x :: l2) (l1 ++ x :: y :: l2) | perm_t_trans : forall l l' l'' : list A, Permutation.Permutation_transp l l' -> Permutation.Permutation_transp l' l'' -> Permutation.Permutation_transp l l'' Arguments Permutation.Permutation_transp [A]%type_scope (_ _)%list_scope Arguments Permutation.perm_t_refl [A]%type_scope _%list_scope Arguments Permutation.perm_t_swap [A]%type_scope _ _ (_ _)%list_scope Arguments Permutation.perm_t_trans [A]%type_scope [l l' l'']%list_scope
Forall_cons_inv : forall (X : Type) (P : X -> Prop) (x : X) (ll : list X), Forall P (x :: ll) < -> P x /\ Forall P ll
Inductive Ltl (A : Set) (leA : A -> A -> Prop) : list A -> list A -> Prop := Lt_nil : forall (a : A) (x : list A), Relation_Operators.Ltl A leA nil (a :: x) | Lt_hd : forall a b : A, leA a b ->...-> Relation_Operators.Ltl A leA (a :: x) (a :: y) Arguments Relation_Operators.Ltl _%type_scope _%function_scope (_ _)%list_scope Arguments Relation_Operators.Lt_nil _%type_scope _%function_scope _ _%list_scope Arguments Relation_Operators.Lt_hd _%type_scope _%function_scope _ _ _ (_ _)%list_scope Arguments Relation_Operators.Lt_tl _%type_scope _%function_scope _ (_ _)%list_scope
map_middle_inv : forall (X Y : Type) (f : X -> Y) (ll : list X) (m : list Y) (y : Y) (n : list Y), map f ll = m ++ y :: n -> {l : list X & {x : X & {r : list X | ll = l ++ x :: r /\ map f l = m /\ f x = y /\ map f r = n}}}
in_nat_sorted_0 = fun l : list nat => match l as l0 return (forall (a : nat) (m : list nat) (b : nat) (r : list nat), nil = l0 ++ a :: m ++ b :: r -> a < b) with | nil => fun (a : nat) (m : list nat) (b : nat) (r : list nat) (H : nil = nil ++ a :: m ++ b :: r) => let H0 : False := eq_ind nil (fun e : list nat => match e with | nil => True | _ :: _ => False end) I (nil ++ a :: m ++ b :: r) H in False_ind (a < b) H0 | n :: l0 => fun (a : nat) (m : list nat) (b : nat) (r : list nat) (H : nil = (n :: l0) ++ a :: m ++ b :: r) => let H0 : False := eq_ind nil (fun e : list nat => match e with |...
in_map_iff : forall (A B : Type) (f : A -> B) (l : list A) (y : B), In y (map f l) < -> (exists x : A, f x = y /\ In x l)

```coq
intros Hlt Hsorted.
inversion Hsorted; subst.
- constructor.
  + intros.
    inversion H; subst.
    contradiction.
  + intros.
    inversion H; subst.
    apply in_nat_sorted_1.
- constructor.
  + intros.
    inversion H; subst.
    apply Hlt.
  + intros.
    inversion H; subst.
    apply H0.
Qed.

original: intros Hlt Hsorted. inversion Hsorted; subst. - constructor. + intros. inversion H; subst. contradiction. + intros. inversion H; subst. apply in_nat_sorted_1. - constructor. + intros. inversion H; subst. apply Hlt. + intros. inversion H; subst. apply H0.
